t: Mark 10
Divorce
Jesus*p then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.
Some*p Pharisees came and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
“What*rp did*r Moses*r command*r you?”*r he replied.
They*p said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
“It*rp was*r because*r your*r hearts*r were*r hard*r that*r Moses*r wrote*r you*r this*r law,”*r Jesus replied.
“But*r at*r the*r beginning*r of*r creation*r God*r ‘made*r them*r male*r and*r female.’*r
‘For*r this*r reason*r a*r man*r will*r leave*r his*r father*r and*r mother*r and*r be*r united*r to*r his*r wife,*r
and*r the*r two*r will*r become*r one*r flesh.’*r So*r they*r are*r no*r longer*r two,*r but*r one*r flesh.*r
Therefore*r what*r God*r has*r joined*r together,*r let*r no*r one*r separate.”*r
When*p they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.
He answered, “Anyone*r who*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r woman*r commits*r adultery*r against*r her.*r
And*r if*r she*r divorces*r her*r husband*r and*r marries*r another*r man,*r she*r commits*r adultery.”*r
The Little Children and Jesus
People*p were bringing little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them, but the disciples rebuked them.

When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them, “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r do*r not*r hinder*r them,*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r belongs*r to*r such*r as*r these.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r anyone*r who*r will*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like*r a*r little*r child*r will*r never*r enter*r it.”*r
And he took the children in his arms, placed his hands on them and blessed them.
The Rich and the Kingdom of God
As*p Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
“Why*rp do*r you*r call*r me*r good?”*r Jesus answered. “No*r one*r is*r good—except*r God*r alone.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments:*r ‘You*r shall*r not*r murder,*r you*r shall*r not*r commit*r adultery,*r you*r shall*r not*r steal,*r you*r shall*r not*r give*r false*r testimony,*r you*r shall*r not*r defraud,*r honor*r your*r father*r and*r mother.’”*r
“Teacher,”*p he declared, “all these I have kept since I was a boy.”

Jesus*p looked at him and loved him. “One*r thing*r you*r lack,”*r he said. “Go,*r sell*r everything*r you*r have*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven.*r Then*r come,*r follow*r me.”*r
At*p this the man’s face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.
Jesus*p looked around and said to his disciples, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r the*r rich*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!”*r
The*p disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, “Children,*r how*r hard*r it*r is*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
It*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r someone*r who*r is*r rich*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
The*p disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, “Who then can be saved?”
Jesus*p looked at them and said, “With*r man*r this*r is*r impossible,*r but*r not*r with*r God;*r all*r things*r are*r possible*r with*r God.”*r
Then*p Peter spoke up, “We have left everything to follow you!”

“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,”*r Jesus replied, “no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r home*r or*r brothers*r or*r sisters*r or*r mother*r or*r father*r or*r children*r or*r fields*r for*r me*r and*r the*r gospel*r

will*r fail*r to*r receive*r a*r hundred*r times*r as*r much*r in*r this*r present*r age:*r homes,*r brothers,*r sisters,*r mothers,*r children*r and*r fields—along*r with*r persecutions—and*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come*r eternal*r life.*r
But*r many*r who*r are*r first*r will*r be*r last,*r and*r the*r last*r first.”*r
Jesus Predicts His Death a Third Time

They*p were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.

“We*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem,”*r he said, “and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r delivered*r over*r to*r the*r chief*r priests*r and*r the*r teachers*r of*r the*r law.*r They*r will*r condemn*r him*r to*r death*r and*r will*r hand*r him*r over*r to*r the*r Gentiles,*r
who*r will*r mock*r him*r and*r spit*r on*r him,*r flog*r him*r and*r kill*r him.*r Three*r days*r later*r he*r will*r rise.”*r
The Request of James and John
Then*p James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
“What*rp do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r he asked.
They*p replied, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”
“You*rp don’t*r know*r what*r you*r are*r asking,”*r Jesus said. “Can*r you*r drink*r the*r cup*r I*r drink*r or*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r I*r am*r baptized*r with?”*r
“We*p can,” they answered. Jesus*p said to them, “You*r will*r drink*r the*r cup*r I*r drink*r and*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r I*r am*r baptized*r with,*r
but*r to*r sit*r at*r my*r right*r or*r left*r is*r not*r for*r me*r to*r grant.*r These*r places*r belong*r to*r those*r for*r whom*r they*r have*r been*r prepared.”*r
When*p the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.

Jesus called them together and said, “You*r know*r that*r those*r who*r are*r regarded*r as*r rulers*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r lord*r it*r over*r them,*r and*r their*r high*r officials*r exercise*r authority*r over*r them.*r
Not*r so*r with*r you.*r Instead,*r whoever*r wants*r to*r become*r great*r among*r you*r must*r be*r your*r servant,*r
and*r whoever*r wants*r to*r be*r first*r must*r be*r slave*r of*r all.*r
For*r even*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r did*r not*r come*r to*r be*r served,*r but*r to*r serve,*r and*r to*r give*r his*r life*r as*r a*r ransom*r for*r many.”*r
Blind Bartimaeus Receives His Sight

Then*p they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (which means “son of Timaeus”), was sitting by the roadside begging.
When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Many*p rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Jesus*p stopped and said, “Call*r him.”*r So*p they called to the blind man, “Cheer up! On your feet! He’s calling you.”
Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.
“What*rp do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r Jesus asked him. The*p blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to see.”
“Go,”*rp said Jesus, “your*r faith*r has*r healed*r you.”*r Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.
